16D5A3550F8842D98DA8F7B2F68DB5CB.description: describe some ways of determining whether something is reasonably priced and therefore a good purchase

B760A8A15CCB4B029C529AEE8EE80EE4.description: explain the relationship between spending and saving, and describe how spending and saving behaviours may differ from one person to another

718479DFAF5F461C8FA0F9986A042E6B.description: explain the concepts of spending, saving, earning, investing, and donating, and identify key factors to consider when making basic decisions related to each

D5022B01686B486D94A04A96835466ED.description: estimate and calculate the cost of transactions involving multiple items priced in whole-dollar amounts, not including sales tax, and the amount of change needed when payment is made in cash, using mental math

449A01EA5ACD4FB5A2BE437F5B88E14A.description: identify various methods of payment that can be used to purchase goods and services

D7203C0B6565416AAFB9C1826F796B40.description: FINANCIAL LITERACY: demonstrate the knowledge and skills needed to make informed financial decisions

CE378E3A035C44BC8711E031AD6EC393.description: apply the formula for the area of a rectangle to find the unknown measurement when given two of the three

252C5BB87913496C85AB22FFD694849E.description: use the row and column structure of an array to measure the areas of rectangles and to show that the area of any rectangle can be found by multiplying its side lengths

8C60A30C11E449FFBFBC9D00FCAC7AD0.description: identify angles and classify them as right, straight, acute, or obtuse

7A5E18BB0E8940C7849860DF863BCE44.description: solve problems involving elapsed time by applying the relationships between different units of time

B292B3F1A48749A5B5248231F145A9A4.description: use metric prefixes to describe the relative size of different metric units, and choose appropriate units and tools to measure length, mass, and capacity

0DE6DE21C5DE4E9DAAA164D6B036E6AF.description: explain the relationships between grams and kilograms as metric units of mass, and between litres and millilitres as metric units of capacity, and use benchmarks for these units to estimate mass and capacity

C96C15419A5C40C3BC85E0A91263FFFF.description: MEASUREMENT: compare, estimate, and determine measurements in various contexts

DF748A33AC804978A41585EFB2D8BE11.description: describe and perform translations and reflections on a grid, and predict the results of these transformations

A04FF727EBAC420F85B66FA62BF8CE0F.description: plot and read coordinates in the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane, and describe the translations that move a point from one coordinate to another

80207FB74B634052A418BAACA3902152.description: identify geometric properties of rectangles, including the number of right angles, parallel and perpendicular sides, and lines of symmetry

A468A210073C44579A92E4B292C1E405.description: GEOMETRY: describe and represent shape, location, and movement by applying geometric properties and spatial relationships in order to navigate the world around them

49640274B55F4ECCBF36FFD93FE0AE32.description: make and test predictions about the likelihood that the mean, median, and mode(s) of a data set will be the same for data collected from different populations

3BD20270ABEF4E79BD9A59BD1A843766.description: use mathematical language, including the terms “impossible”, “unlikely”, “equally likely”, “likely”, and “certain”, to describe the likelihood of events happening, represent this likelihood on a probability line, and use it to make predictions and informed decisions

414826A9CB724CE494CB6CF4D5B77B53.description: PROBABILITY: describe the likelihood that events will happen, and use that information to make predictions

6E6CDCA0792C468FB180017E267FEF72.description: analyse different sets of data presented in various ways, including in stem-and-leaf plots and multiple-bar graphs, by asking and answering questions about the data and drawing conclusions, then make convincing arguments and informed decisions

AF9CD3874A654D089E809915AD88168F.description: determine the mean and the median and identify the mode(s), if any, for various data sets involving whole numbers, and explain what each of these measures indicates about the data

73C4264F246142308B2E636D2A2977BE.description: create an infographic about a data set, representing the data in appropriate ways, including in frequency tables, stem-and-leaf plots, and multiple-bar graphs, and incorporating any other relevant information that helps to tell a story about the data

F0DA4F1F2DDC49DE97E1FB03A02D13EB.description: select from among a variety of graphs, including multiple-bar graphs, the type of graph best suited to represent various sets of data; display the data in the graphs with proper sources, titles, and labels, and appropriate scales; and justify their choice of graphs

61082D1F7F8D4F7287B75135CFE1986E.description: collect data from different primary and secondary sources to answer questions of interest that involve comparing two or more sets of data, and organize the data in frequency tables and stem-and-leaf plots

FB86F2B0E4AE492FA5609658E581547E.description: describe the difference between qualitative and quantitative data, and describe situations where each would be used

490D058E4AD1473E8CD182D85DB12B32.description: DATA LITERACY: manage, analyse, and use data to make convincing arguments and informed decisions, in various contexts drawn from real life

FA0C3D5496DC4122BC5D58833F828AAD.description: read and alter existing code, including code that involves sequential, concurrent, repeating, and nested events, and describe how changes to the code affect the outcomes

F281D728FFEE4348BB1CBF3251E3A432.description: solve problems and create computational representations of mathematical situations by writing and executing code, including code that involves sequential, concurrent, repeating, and nested events

302D0AFAA5E4460BB370D175C94033D0.description: CODING: solve problems and create computational representations of mathematical situations using coding concepts and skills

71F629C86B774B41BFAEE936E2E339C0.description: solve inequalities that involve addition and subtraction of whole numbers up to 20, and verify and graph the solutions

3C0260AD4C064D338CE76848511E8DAA.description: solve equations that involve whole numbers up to 50 in various contexts, and verify solutions

0371246EF7014E6996B989F20F1FD8B9.description: identify and use symbols as variables in expressions and equations

7FED8BF2648B49DFB07D3B6D730B133B.description: EQUATIONS AND INEQUALITIES: demonstrate an understanding of variables, expressions, equalities, and inequalities, and apply this understanding in various contexts

A7D6E542AEAD4E1CB11E81A7B55933EB.description: create and describe patterns to illustrate relationships among whole numbers and decimal tenths

EDE86ED806DC426A97230FA997E2F291.description: determine pattern rules and use them to extend patterns, make and justify predictions, and identify missing elements in repeating and growing patterns

A132E07C732D4E02B639718BC053D587.description: create and translate repeating and growing patterns using various representations, including tables of values and graphs

9E423842947245D6A07A32CD7D4FD649.description: identify and describe repeating and growing patterns, including patterns found in real-life contexts

469773BEEF7B4DBCAC33DE6BE370E5F1.description: PATTERN AND RELATIONSHIPS: identify, describe, extend, create, and make predictions about a variety of patterns, including those found in real-life contexts

2FE7534C96044158AB9057612BCAA032.description: show simple multiplicative relationships involving whole-number rates, using various tools and drawings

76FE9D2D852A484D9E144BD39E7C09DE.description: represent the relationship between the repeated addition of a unit fraction and the multiplication of that unit fraction by a whole number, using tools, drawings, and standard fractional notation

506C9C9F93784BECA206B78A64AC9A69.description: represent and solve problems involving the division of two- or three-digit whole numbers by one-digit whole numbers, expressing any remainder as a fraction when appropriate, using appropriate tools, including arrays

21124B7B81FE4B9EA7460AA23B22B531.description: represent and solve problems involving the multiplication of two- or three-digit whole numbers by one-digit whole numbers and by 10, 100, and 1000, using appropriate tools, including arrays

8701C015442048C6A8B1F6672F7C6819.description: represent and solve problems involving the addition and subtraction of whole numbers that add up to no more than 10 000 and of decimal tenths, using appropriate tools and strategies, including algorithms

41D7829D15BD41308ECAE8FB8D26E47A.description: use mental math strategies to multiply whole numbers by 10, 100, and 1000, divide whole numbers by 10, and add and subtract decimal tenths, and explain the strategies used

631855CFF02B40E196C5C8AF0322A20E.description: recall and demonstrate multiplication facts for 1 × 1 to 10 × 10, and related division facts

06E53DA178C1458DA647F3EE62DC1DE1.description: use the properties of operations, and the relationships between addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division, to solve problems involving whole numbers, including those requiring more than one operation, and check calculations

1D284D6E33D0458FB87965E5F95C7C68.description: OPERATIONS: use knowledge of numbers and operations to solve mathematical problems encountered in everyday life

3C7702268EB14DD48DED1B84980C87E5.description: describe relationships and show equivalences among fractions and decimal tenths, in various contexts

E9767B0644494368AC9EFDABCAD93BE7.description: round decimal numbers to the nearest whole number, in various contexts

D8DB02C40DAE46B79BA3F9CF40C879C8.description: read, represent, compare, and order decimal tenths, in various contexts

A27E72FF6D704593B32D26163C521DD3.description: count to 10 by halves, thirds, fourths, fifths, sixths, eighths, and tenths, with and without the use of tools

A26C8918EFC04F8384FB787982B42AF2.description: use drawings and models to represent, compare, and order fractions representing the individual portions that result from two different fair-share scenarios involving any combination of 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 10 sharers

A662C0FEFCEE4228A1DA5621EB3F14D7.description: represent fractions from halves to tenths using drawings, tools, and standard fractional notation, and explain the meanings of the denominator and the numerator

837C33F52BE54B5691E009D16DED3DAA.description: round whole numbers to the nearest ten, hundred, or thousand, in various contexts

CF5B3E98DA3947898906951A4CA1B438.description: compare and order whole numbers up to and including 10 000, in various contexts

3AF6CB828A05474C964B0FEB2EC7B3FD.description: read, represent, compose, and decompose whole numbers up to and including 10 000, using appropriate tools and strategies, and describe various ways they are used in everyday life

EE2A33F3E0AC4C8F886C8C7696FD64A5.description: NUMBER SENSE: demonstrate an understanding of numbers and make connections to the way numbers are used in everyday life
